text: Ralph Walter McGehee (April 9, 1928 - May 2, 2020) was an American intelligence official. He worked for 25 years in American intelligence, being a former case officer of the Central Intelligence Agency (CIA). From 1953 to 1972, his assignments were in East Asia and Southeast Asia. After leaving the CIA, he published books and became a critic of the agency. McGehee was born in Moline, Illinois. McGehee died on May 2, 2020 of COVID-19 in Falmouth, Maine at the age of 92.Obituary: Ralph Walter McGehee Jr. ==References== Category:1928 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in the United States Category:CIA people Category:Writers from Illinois Category:Military people from Illinois
title: Ralph McGehee
